means: 使变青白，使变苍白( etiolate的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Young etiolated leaves may also be accompanied by cell division.
sentence.Network_cn: 幼小的黄化叶子也可能伴随细胞分裂.

sentence.Network_en: These compounds are present in etiolated tissue of seedlings grown in darkness.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些化合物存在于黑暗中生长的幼苗的黄化组织内.

sentence.Network_en: Illumination of the etiolated seedlings produces marked changes in growth habit.
sentence.Network_cn: 黄化幼苗照光后,生长习性发生明显变化.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: from the verb etiolate (from French étioler, from Norman French étieuler 'grow into haulm') + -ed

means.word_mean: 1. (especially of plants) developed without chlorophyll by being deprived of light;
